recommended_activities.title: Explore Central Park
recommended_activities.description: An urban park in Manhattan that offers sprawling meadows, walking trails, picturesque bodies of water, and historic landmarks. Great for picnics, jogging, and relaxing in the summer.
recommended_activities.reasoning: Central Park is a must-see in New York City, offering diverse recreational opportunities and scenic beauty, all for free. Ideal for a cost-effective, enjoyable day.

recommended_activities.title: Explore the High Line
recommended_activities.description: A linear park built on a historic freight rail line elevated above the streets on Manhattan’s West Side, featuring lush gardens and stunning views of the Hudson River.
recommended_activities.reasoning: The High Line is a unique urban park experience and is free to visit, providing both scenic beauty and a touch of New York's history.

recommended_activities.title: Explore Times Square
recommended_activities.description: The bustling heart of Midtown Manhattan, famous for its bright lights, Broadway theaters, and electronic billboards.
recommended_activities.reasoning: A visit to Times Square is essential for any NYC trip and is free to experience. It’s the perfect place for people-watching, photography, and soaking in the vibrant city atmosphere.

recommended_activities.title: Visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art
recommended_activities.description: One of the world's largest and finest art museums. Its collection includes over two million works of art spanning 5,000 years of world history.
recommended_activities.reasoning: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is a staple in New York and offers an extensive collection of art that can keep visitors engrossed for hours. Perfect for a budget-friendly visit with numerous exhibitions and often discounted tickets.

recommended_activities.title: Visit the Brooklyn Museum
recommended_activities.description: A renowned cultural institution with a wide-ranging collection of art, particularly strong in Egyptian antiquities, African art, and contemporary work. Admission is pay-what-you-wish.
recommended_activities.reasoning: The Brooklyn Museum is perfect for art lovers on a budget. Its 'pay-what-you-wish' policy makes it an accessible and enriching experience for any traveler.

recommended_activities.title: Walk Across the Brooklyn Bridge
recommended_activities.description: Take a walk across this iconic bridge that connects Manhattan and Brooklyn. It offers stunning views of the city skyline and the East River.
recommended_activities.reasoning: Walking the Brooklyn Bridge is one of the most iconic and cost-effective ways to experience New York City. It's free and provides excellent photo opportunities.

recommended_activities.title: Attend a Free Outdoor Concert
recommended_activities.description: Enjoy free music performances in various NYC parks during the summer, including SummerStage, Bryant Park 'Picnic Performances', and New York Philharmonic's 'Concert in the Parks'.
recommended_activities.reasoning: These concerts provide an excellent opportunity to experience New York’s vibrant cultural scene without spending much money, all while enjoying the beautiful summer weather.

recommended_activities.title: Watch a Movie in a Park
recommended_activities.description: Enjoy the warm summer evenings by watching free movies in city parks. Events like 'Movies Under the Stars' take place in various locations around the city.
recommended_activities.reasoning: It's a quintessential NYC summer activity that combines outdoor fun with free entertainment, making it a great budget-friendly option.

recommended_activities.title: Visit Governors Island
recommended_activities.description: A unique island oasis just a short ferry ride from Lower Manhattan, offering historical forts, bike rentals, and outdoor art installations.
recommended_activities.reasoning: Governors Island is a cheap and quick escape from the city, with ferry rides costing just a few dollars and plenty of free activities once you arrive.

recommended_activities.title: Visit the Bronx Museum of the Arts
recommended_activities.description: An art museum that specializes in contemporary art and also highlights the work of under-represented artists. Admission is free.
recommended_activities.reasoning: This museum offers a unique cultural experience without the burden of an entry fee, making it perfect for budget-conscious travelers.

recommended_activities.title: Explore Prospect Park
recommended_activities.description: Designed by the same architects of Central Park, this Brooklyn park offers meadows, forests, lakes, and recreational facilities.
recommended_activities.reasoning: Prospect Park provides a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of the city, offering similar features to Central Park but often with fewer crowds. It's free to enter and enjoy.

recommended_activities.title: Visit the Hispanic Society Museum & Library
recommended_activities.description: Home to Joaquín Sorolla's 'Vision of Spain' series and a broad collection of Hispanic art and cultural artifacts. Admission is free.
recommended_activities.reasoning: This museum offers a deep dive into Hispanic culture and art at no cost, making it a meaningful and wallet-friendly addition to your itinerary.

recommended_activities.title: Check Out the Staten Island Greenbelt
recommended_activities.description: A network of lush, green spaces on Staten Island, featuring hiking trails, nature centers, and scenic views.
recommended_activities.reasoning: This park offers a slice of nature and numerous free outdoor activities, perfect for budget-conscious travelers who enjoy hiking and exploring the outdoors.

recommended_activities.title: Visit Pelham Bay Park
recommended_activities.description: New York City's largest park, located in the Bronx, offering hiking trails, picnic areas, and scenic landscapes.
recommended_activities.reasoning: Pelham Bay Park provides a wide array of free outdoor activities and is less crowded than more famous parks, making it ideal for a budget-friendly day out.
